steps.title: Wash your okra using tap water.
steps.content: Wash your okra using tap water. Always wash fresh produce before eating it. Run your okra under tap water, turning it as necessary, to clean all sides. Shake off the okra to dry or dab it dry with paper towels. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Slice your okra.
steps.content: Slice your okra. Start by slicing and discarding the stems on either end. [2] X Expert Source Dorrenda Smith Personal Chef Expert Interview. 26 October 2021. Then, slice the okra into thin, round slices. [3] X Research source Use a chef's knife or paring knife to slice the okra.

steps.title: Soak the okra in vinegar.
steps.content: Soak the okra in vinegar. Okra sometimes comes out a little slimy. To prevent this, soak your okra slices in vinegar after cutting them. Combine a cup of vinegar with a quart of water. Immerse your okra in this mixture. Allow it to soak for one hour. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Dry your okra completely.
steps.content: Dry your okra completely. Do not cook wet okra. This can contribute to sliminess. Let okra air dry on a paper towel. If you need to cook your okra fast, you can pat it down with paper towel until it dries. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Bring a pot of salted water to a boil.
steps.content: Bring a pot of salted water to a boil. Lightly salt as much water as you need to submerge all your okra. Place your pot over high heat and bring the water to a boil. [6] X Research source Try drizzling some lemon juice in the water. Some people find this cuts down on sliminess and it can also add some flavor. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Cook the okra in the water.
steps.content: Cook the okra in the water. Once your water is boiling, add your okra to the sauce pan. Cover the pan and set a timer. Okra takes between 8 and 10 minutes to cook. [8] X Research source Okra should be soft and tender when it's done cooking.

steps.title: Drain the okra.
steps.content: Drain the okra. Make sure you get all the water out. Use a colander to drain out all the water. Shake the colander if necessary to get out excess water. Okra is prone to sliminess, so keep it as dry as possible. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Season the okra.
steps.content: Season the okra. Okra can be seasoned with a little butter, salt, and pepper. Boiled okra does not require a lot of seasoning, but if you prefer a particular flavor profile you can season the okra how you want. For example, you can add dried basil and garlic to your okra. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Prepare a coating.
steps.content: Prepare a coating. Fried okra should be coated in flour, cornmeal, salt, and any spices you want. [11] X Expert Source Dorrenda Smith Personal Chef Expert Interview. 26 October 2021. Mix half a cup of flour, half a cup of cornmeal, and half a teaspoon of salt together. Then, add a quarter teaspoon of any spices you want, such as black pepper or cayenne pepper. [12] X Research source You should also prepare a liquid to coat the okra in first so the coating sticks. Beat one egg together with one egg with a tablespoon of milk.

steps.title: Heat your oil.
steps.content: Heat your oil. Coat a pan with a light amount of cooking oil such as olive oil. [13] X Expert Source Dorrenda Smith Personal Chef Expert Interview. 26 October 2021. Heat the pan over medium high heat for a few minutes. [14] X Research source To check if the oil is ready, toss a small bit of food into the pan. If it sizzles, the oil is ready to use.

steps.title: Coat your okra.
steps.content: Coat your okra. One by one, coat your pieces of okra. Set them aside on a plate until they're all coated. Dip the okra in the egg milk mixture. Then, dip it in the flour mixture until all sides are evenly coated. [15] X Research source

steps.title: Cook the okra.
steps.content: Cook the okra. Add as much okra to the oil as fits. Pieces of okra should not touch and have a little space around one another. Fry the okra for three to four minutes per side. [16] X Expert Source Dorrenda Smith Personal Chef Expert Interview. 26 October 2021. Each side of the okra should be golden brown by the time it's done cooking. [17] X Research source

steps.title: Remove the okra.
steps.content: Remove the okra. Use a slotted spoon to remove okra from the oil. Place your okra on a plate covered in paper towel. Allow the okra to cool for a few minutes before eating. [18] X Research source
